intro: Xylopia plowmanii, commonly known as the African bitter almond. It is a member of the Annonaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate to elliptic in shape. The fruit is a smooth, fleshy berry that turns from green to yellow or red when mature.
